intro: Nototriche macrotuba, commonly known as the giant tuberous nototriche, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its robust, tuberous roots and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are usually broad and lance-shaped, while its flowers bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
